info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 17 at 5:05PM CDT until April 17 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CALDWELL...JACKSON...SOUTHWESTERN OUACHITA AND NORTHEASTERN WINN PARISHES... At 504 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 17 miles southwest of Brownsville-Bawcom to 19 miles northeast of Winnfield to 9 miles south of Jonesboro, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jonesboro, Chatham, Dodson, Eros, Sikes, Vixen, Bosco, Hudson and Luna. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
